input.description:
DHCP flag [optional] The flag to indicate whether or not DHCP (dynamic host control protocol) is used to determine DNS configuration automatically.
valid values: true, false
virtual NIC device [optional] If DHCP is enabled, the DHCP DNS of the service console network adapter will override the system DNS. This field is ignored if DHCP is disabled by the dhcp property.

host name [optional] The host name portion of DNS name. For example, "esx01". Note: When DHCP is not enabled, the property can be set explicitly. When DHCP is enabled, the property reflects the current DNS configuration, but cannot be set.

domain name [optional] The domain name portion of the DNS name. For example, "vmware.com". Note: When DHCP is not enabled, the property can be set explicitly. When DHCP is enabled, the property reflects the current DNS configuration, but cannot be set.

address list [optional] list of the IP addresses of the DNS servers, placed in order of preference. Note: When DHCP is not enabled, the property can be set explicitly. When DHCP is enabled, the property reflects the current DNS configuration, but cannot be set. Value takes the form:
<address-list> <address></address> <address></address> ............. <address-list>
address: The IP addresses of the DNS servers, placed in order of preference. Note: When DHCP is not enabled, the property can be set explicitly. When DHCP is enabled, the property reflects the current DNS configuration, but cannot be set. Valid values: String

search domain list [optional] list of the domain in which to search for hosts, placed in order of preference. Note: When DHCP is not enabled, the property can be set explicitly. When DHCP is enabled, the property reflects the current DNS configuration, but cannot be set. Value takes the form:
<search-domain-list> <search-domain></search-domain> <search-domain></search-domain> ........... <search-domain-list>
search-domain: The domain in which to search for hosts, placed in order of preference. Note: When DHCP is not enabled, the property can be set explicitly. When DHCP is enabled, the property reflects the current DNS configuration, but cannot be set. Valid values: String

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <dns-config> <dhcp>${dhcp flag}</dhcp> <virtual-nic-device>${virtual nic device}</virtual-nic-device> <host-name>${host name}</host-name> <domain-name>${domain name}</domain-name> ${address list}${search domain list} </dns-config> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>
